sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SALZBRUNN, a small German watering-place, visited annually by about 4000 patients, is situated in Silesia, 30 miles to the south-west of Breslau. Its alkalo-saline springs, which are especially efficacious in pulmonary complaints, were known as early as 1316, but afterwards fell into disuse until their merits were once more discovered at the beginning of this century. The resident population in 1880 numbered 5777.
